content.title: Green Design System
content.summary: is built to support creation of beautiful, consistent and accessible financial products for generations to come.

items.title: Alert
items.summary: An alert displays important messages, feedback, or time-sensitive information.

items.title: Badge
items.summary: A compact visual indicator for status, counts and notifications.

items.title: Blur
items.summary: The Blur component is used to apply a blur effect over content, often used to obscure sensitive or background information.

items.title: Breadcrumbs
items.summary: A breadcrumb is a secondary navigation showing the website hierarchy.

items.title: Button
items.summary: A button can be tapped or clicked to perform an action.

items.title: Calendar
items.summary: The calendar displays a grid of selectable dates.

items.title: Card
items.summary: The card groups related content into a single container.

items.title: Checkbox
items.summary: A checkbox is a form control that allows users to select one or multiple options.

items.title: Coachmark
items.summary: Coachmarks guide users through interface features.

items.title: Context menu
items.summary: A context menu displays a list of contextual actions.

items.title: Datepicker
items.summary: ⁠The datepicker allows users to select a date.

items.title: Details
items.summary: The details component is a collapsible section that helps organize and hide content until needed.

items.title: Dialog
items.summary: ⁠A dialog appears in front of content to provide critical information or ask for a decision.

items.title: Div
items.summary: Div is a base element in the declarative layout system.

items.title: Divider
items.summary: Divider creates visual and semantic separation between content.

items.title: Dropdown
items.summary: A dropdown enables the user to choose one or multiple options from a list.

items.title: FAB
items.summary: Floating action button persists across screens for constant access to features that needs to be accessible at all times.

items.title: Filter chips
items.summary: Filter chips allow users to narrow down the data they want to see on the page.

items.title: Form summary
items.summary: Form summary shows all form errors in one place.

items.title: Grid
items.summary: The grid is a custom element that provides a flexible grid system.

items.title: Icon
items.summary: An icon helps communicate meaning quickly, enhances visual hierarchy, and supports navigation or interaction.

items.title: Image
items.summary: An image displays media with configurable dimensions and styling properties.

items.title: Input
items.summary: An input lets users enter and edit text or numerical values in forms.

items.title: Link
items.summary: A link navigates users to other pages or sections of content.

items.title: Menu button
items.summary: A menu button combines button and link behaviors for navigation menus.

items.title: Monthpicker
items.summary: The monthpicker displays a grid of selectable months.

items.title: Popover
items.summary: A popover is a temporary view that appears above other content.

items.title: Radio
items.summary: A radio button is a form control that allows users to select one of the predefined set of choices.

items.title: Rich text
items.summary: Rich text can be used to wrap generic HTML content and apply typography styles.

items.title: Segmented control
items.summary: Segmented control allows users to select a single option, immediately changing the display to reflect their selection. It is used for switching views or view options, not for navigation.

items.title: Select
items.summary: A select enables the user to choose one or multiple options from a list.

items.title: Signal
items.summary: A signal draws attention to notifications and new content.

items.title: Text
items.summary: Text summary

items.title: Textarea
items.summary: Textarea allow users to input text and digits on multiple lines.

items.title: Theme
items.summary: Theme summary

items.title: Video
items.summary: Video summary

items.title: Yearpicker
items.summary: The yearpicker displays a grid of selectable years.

items.title: About
items.summary: Green Design System is the design system for Skandinaviska Enskilda Banken to make it easier and faster to build beautiful digital products and experiences under the SEB brand.

items.title: Accessibility
items.summary: Accessibility is central to SEB’s digital experience. The Green Design System is designed to make our services usable for everyone – improving clarity, usability, and overall experience.

items.title: Applied design
items.summary: Applied design shows how our visual design comes to life in concrete examples - with templates and clear guidance for building layouts.

items.title: Spacing
items.summary: Spacing is a fundamental tool for structuring layouts. In Green, we use spacing to create hierarchy, balance, and visual rhythm, making interfaces feel intentional and easy to navigate.

items.title: Visual direction
items.summary: Our visual language helps the user to navigate, make choices and solve problems. With usability and writing as core pillars the visual design inherits the brand principles in a digital context.

items.title: Design direction
items.summary: At SEB, digital design is not just about aesthetics - it’s about clarity, function, and supporting the user journey. We simplify and remove obstacles, with accessibility and writing as equal parts.

items.title: Figma
items.summary: Figma is our core design tool, where you’ll find everything needed to create consistent and user-friendly experiences. Components, variables, and typography styles to icons and more - all in one place.

items.title: Primitives
items.summary: The primitives represent the fundamental parts of the design system like colors, typography, spacing, and sizing. This ensures consistency across the entire design system.

items.title: Colours
items.summary: Colour is a powerful tool in design, shaping hierarchy, guiding attention, and reinforcing brand identity. In Green, colours work alongside whitespace and typography to create clarity and balance.

items.title: Design tokens
items.summary: Design tokens capture colors, typography, spacing, and other design decisions as named, reusable values used in designs, tools, and code - keeping interfaces consistent and easy to update.

items.title: Typography
items.summary: Typography plays a crucial role in shaping the look and feel of our design. It not only impacts readability but also establish our brand identity.

items.title: Declarative layout
items.summary: A micro-frontend optimized layout system for responsive layouts without utility classes. The relationships between elements rely on the set rules for spacing, grids, and sizing, ensuring consistency throughout.

items.title: Icons
items.summary: Icons are a powerful tool in the interface. When used consistently, icons strengthen brand expression, improve usability, and create a more intuitive experience.

items.title: UX writing
items.summary: Wherever customers meet us, their experience of SEB should be consistent. A good experience builds trust and can lead to new business. Customer-facing text must be correct – mistakes distract and reduce credibility.

items.title: Declarative layout: Property to token table
items.code:
Property group Token collection
